comment: He doesn't curve at all - including the ACS final. He sometimes does an online quiz for added points to the test. Gives extremely mixed signals and doesn't communicate well. I went to his office hours. He wasn't there. Next class I asked him about it - he says not to come and ask during class. 3 weeks later - berates the class for not coming to OH.
He's a very knowledgeable professor but his lectures were often hard to follow. If you take him, be prepared to self-study before each lecture.

"Professor Msimanga isn't just a professor; he's a legend. His lectures are so mesmerizing that even the molecules in the air seem to pay attention. It takes some time to understand his accent and some reading but it should be an easy class. By no means slack off though!

Bad lectures. I attended every class but learned basically nothing there. People I talked to shared the same opinion. What partially saved our grades is the fact that his assignments are set up well and there aren't many of them. The class has 4 tests and 4 assignments. The assignments prepare you for the test well but you're on your own learning

I see no reason for not getting an A in Dr. Msimanga lab if you actually ask and willing to put in the work. Yes, lab reports can be hard but he will go over it during class. There will be pre-lab quizzes base on lab manual (like every other chem lab).

So I'm going to be clear and honest. He is very sweet, but you have to tell him what your problem is for any reason if it is homework or if it is exam. He has accent but is understood. BUT, CHEM1212 is a hard class and study if you want A. 4 exams he accepts the 3 highest. 4 Problem sets which is same as the exam. Study with others and you're fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: He graded labs harshly. Final exam has many questions from other lecture classes, questions you wouldn't be able to answer if you only took the lab so beware. He plays favorites; if you go to office hours then he'll grant you an extension, for example. If you didn't go to office hours, no extension for you. Nice in person but not when grading.

He was very accessible outside of class. He responded to emails, calls, and helped a lot with lab reports outside of class. The class was painful to sit through, and it didnt seem like a positive lab environment. He grades fair enough, but its a lot of work for a decent grade as the class itself is difficult. He doesnt just give out good grades.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Super caring and funny, but tests were very difficult, wish I did more practice problems, study the problem sets because they are very similar to exercises and exams. But he does offer extra credit opportunities, so take advantage of those because you will need it. Feel like if I put more work into studying, I would have gotten an A.

I had to create an account just to give this review. Stay away at all costs. He doesn't explain the problems during lecture and he likes to switch up the test from the study guide, which is okay unless its questions that is completely different from what we learned. He gives "extra credit" on the test but counts it against you if you get it wrong.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He teaches a very tough course but he gives you opportunities to learn from his lectures and homework. He does reviews for test before and after along with adding the most missed questions of the test on the next one for extra credit added to the previous test. It's a course you have to work for but I HIGHLY respect and suggest this professor!

Other than his harsh grading, he is a wonderful professor. He wants his students to learn and really know the course content. It won't be an easy A, but it's doable if you actually learn. He also has a good sense of humor, and he responds to emails fairly quickly.

LOVE THIS MAN!! I took him for 2-3 classes before so I know him pretty well. Took him for Forensics chem and enjoyed the class a lot! People give him bad rep cause they don't put work in but if you come to class and ask for help, he is very helpful and passionate. The only con is he is bad with technology so he doesn't respond to emails sometimes.

Got to be the worst chemistry teacher i have ever had. The lectures are not good at all and there are no examples. We never went over the unit homework once. There are 5 tests plus the final for the semester and nothing gets dropped. Study materials provided are scarce and the textbook isn't much use. This prof has made me want to change my major.

I loved Dr. Msimanga. He was a very nice professor that was always accessible during office hours. He explained every question in DETAIL and really made me understand the content. I took him over the summer and it wasn't that difficult. Make sure you know how to approach the different types of problems on his study guides. He gives Bonus points!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Msimanga is a unique teacher. He is a funny guy that really seems to care about his students, he had our class laughing quite a few times. However, he goes through material really fast and does not do almost any practice problems. And then on the test there are a bunch of problems he never worked through. Its a hard class, but it can be done.

He's not an awful teacher. Tests are harder than expected eveytime. 80% of the test is covered in class however all of it is worded differently. His slide shows are straight from the book  and any study guides he gives you for the test especially the last few tests are either too easy or has nothing to do with the test. Acs final sucks. And is 15%.

this professor is hard to understand with the accent and all but the class is really not that difficult if you are good at math based scientific equations and know how to do dimensional analysis. Barely studied but went to the Friday sessions and did just fine.

He is really not a bad professor! I didn't buy the book and managed to get a c out if the class if I would have studied more and did sapling on time I could've made an A. The accent is strong but not that distracting. Tips to succeed: study, DO SAPLING and just go to class oh yea and DO SAPLING that's really what boosts your grade :) good luck

He was the worst chemistry instructor I have ever had. Words cannot accurately describe how useless lecture was and how helpless he makes his students feel. The sapling work needed several corrections and his "practice tests " were frustrating . Learn from my mistakes and pick a different instructor.

Dr. Msimanga is an extremely hard professor and it sometimes feels as if he assigns unnecessary work like the sapling. If you want to get a good grade you must put the time in and spend a lot of time in the chem lab
did not understand him or the material at all

He has the heaviest accent! It was difficult to understand him and when i went up to ask for help, he said he was full time teacher and didn't have time to help anyone. I had to drop his class and get a W because i couldn't learn in his class. I had to teach myself everything and had to rely on Lab and Peer Led Sessions.

Ever heard of saplinglearning.com? It's the way this professor prefers us to complete and turn in homework. It's pretty terrible (I can't stand it at least). If you prefer to do problems from a book or on an assignment (like me!) you won't like this course very much.

He's not a bad guy, he's just really hard to understand in class and often confuses himself.  Others have mentioned that he makes mistakes on problem sets in class and doesn't bother to correct them, which is true.  I think this is a case of a professor who doesn't really want to be teaching a lower-level class, but is being forced to.

Dr. M is a hard professor. He will help you when you are trying and he recognizes you from class. Stand out and put forth an effort for this class and you have the potential to do really well. The tests are hard, but some of the questions he will repeat from the pervious test almost verbatim so you get better grades. Pay attention and go to class.

He is very rude!! I tried to be nice to him and ask him for help, and he just stared at me blankly. He is not approachable and you cannot understand him at all! Do not take!!!! There are way better chemistry professors at Kennesaw than him.

Dr. M. gets terrible rates on here and I find that to be highly unfair. He is an outstanding professor with a passion for chemistry and a desire to pass his vast wealth of knowledge on to students. He wants to see his students succeed, thus he pushes students to their full potential. His class is only difficult for the lazy minded.

I just finished 1211 with Dr. Msimanga and loved every minute of it. He has an accent that people complained about, but I had no problems understanding him. He knows his subject matter very well and cares about his students making good grades. Most people who didn't pass or didn't do well just simply didn't show up to class. Great professor!

This teacher's notes are incredibly hard to follow if you have no prior chemistry experience. Also, he has a very thick accent that is hard to understand in class. I took this course over the summer and he barely covered all the material. I learned most of it from my lab class instructor and lab partner. DO NOT TAKE HIM IF YOU HAVE A CHOICE.

I took this class over the summer thinking I was going to die because of all the horrible things people said about him, but I got an A. He is not a tough professor but the subject is hard. He is there to help you whenever you need it.
He is a very good teacher. Always answer questions in details. Loved him

do not take Msimanga. I do not mind difficult professors if I learn the material, but this is different. His test have 3 answers within (.002) difference. Brown nose ur way to an A. Learn the way he thinks and do everything he tells you to do. go to his office every single day. Most straight A students get their first C here. Take Dockery,or bend

Ok, so he's pretty a-nal but really, what kind of rednecks are posting on here? Affirmative Action??? Come on, he's tough, and I got a B, a hard semester, but I landed a job at a research company bc of my skills I gained from this class.

Ok, so he's pretty a-nal but really, what kind of rednecks are posting on here? Affirmative Action??? Come on, he's tough, and I got a B, a hard semester, but I landed a job at a research company bc of my skills I gained from this class.
horrible, unorganized, hard to understand, every test average less than 60.

There is no partial credit for anything.  If you report the answer in the wrong amount of significant figures you get a 0.  If you use a literature Ka value from a different source than his, you get a 0.  If you know the material, but you answer is off by <1%, you get a 0.  He is too lazy and disorganized to grant partial credit.

This is without a doubt the worst teacher I have had so far in my 4 years of college.  I honestly believe he doesn't know the material well enough to relay it to the class.  There is no class structure.  Grades are calculated inconsistently and do not add up logically.  For example, if you miss 2 out of 20 on a problem set that's an F.

Do Not Take Him!!! He is AWFULLL!! Couldnt understand anything he ever said. His doesnt have any structure. Drops the lowest test grade. It is important to do well on the problem sets. But try your best not to take him! Trust Me!

HORRIBLE TEACHER; DO NOT TAKE! I usually love chemistry, but this professor is the worst I've had at KSU. His lectures don't make sense and are incomprehensible. He says he will stay to help you but does not, and his tests are only about 20 questions over at least three chapters and have very little to do with the information in the book.

Made tests harder than they should be (trick questions, material that we had not even gone over, etc.).  He was constantly making mistakes/typos on important things in class notes, homework worksheets and even on tests.  It was not unusual to have a multiple choice test/worksheet and not even have a correct answer in the choices.

This is the worst professor I have ever had. He is not helpful at all. I feel like I taught myself everything. Might as well not go to class and just save your time and teach yourself. He makes a lot of mistakes and tests are way harder than expected.

im doing ok n the class, but ive been teaching myself. if u have a hard time learning things on ur own & need step by step explanations like me, DONT TAKE! the 1 good thing about his class is he lets u use graphing calculators, so u can store info and use it on the test, the bad thing is, its rediculous the the amount/things he expects u 2 remeber

He definately is not a good teacher. He is very confusing, I had to get a tutor in his class. His tests seem easy until you get it back and realize you did really bad, one test average was a 60. He doesn't answer your questions clearly and your better off not paying attention and having a tutor teach it all to you or else you will just get confused

Horrible teacher.  Mistakes on information presented in lectures and overheads. Accent can be difficult to understand. He seems proud that his class test avg is in the 60s. Multiple Choice test ?s are tricky.  If you know the material and manage trick ?s well, you may do ok. I knew the material I missed on test, but did poorly due to trick test ?s

A very ok person, but a horrible teacher. He has a very strong accent. He does not respond to emails. The only way to catch him is at his office. Does not clarify things well. I advise: DO NOT TAKE, if you dont have a strong background in chem. Avoid as much as possible.
He has a very heavy african accent that is very hard to understand.  He is a poor teacher who repeats everything and is not very clear is his meanings.

Nice guy. Not good at explaining. Talkes about non relevent things in class and not enough time spent explaining the basics to understand the bigger picture. I have to re take chemistry because I understood nothing from his class.
It's a tough class. Dr M does his best to convey the info he wants you to know. He uses 98%lecture and 2%book for tests.  I would take him again if I had to, but I'm also a chem major.

One of the worst profs. I've ever had. His accent is not too bad, but he does not teach well, is easily confused and very disorganized and he's lost several of our quizzes, tests and lab reports. He does not believe in reviewing for tests. He is inconsiderate of students' time, putting up quizzes and assignments the night before they are due.

Very good prof.Very helpful and is happy to answer any questions.Grades each lab fairly and gives partial credit.Sometimes hard to understand,but as long as you pay attention and do each lab you will do well in this class.

He was very hard to understand. His tests had nothing to do with his lectures, I found myself having to teach the material to myself. Unless you want to add a lot of stress and anxiety to your life... DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!!
i had him for lab. his prelab is really useful, he explains a lot. when we asked him questions, he rnever really answered them but hes not bad.

Great at explaining & teaching. I had a hard time figuring out test date changes/quiz due dates. He'd say in class or online, but usually not both. B/c it was summer, twice he lectured then we had a test on that material.  I need time to study b/f tests not just a lecture! He did curve grades. Was very nice & approachable & gave a takehome test.

He has a very thick accent and prefers students to learn from lectures. He loses tests and quizes and gets confused himself about things he just stated. Unless you want more stress in your life do not take this class!!!!

Not the best but not horrible either. If you want an easy A, take the class. I never had to study for a test and I went into the final with a 100 average. he curves. Lectures are rather boring but I had him for 3 hour classes in the summer so i'm a bit tainted. He can be confusing at times but ask him enough and eventually he can explain things...

He is a good teacher if you are really interested in chemistry.  He does what he can to assist his students in doing well and UNDERSTANDING the material.  He is all about critical thinking and cracking jokes in the middle of lectures...Not an "easy" a, but a good chemistry professor.

stay away!! dr. msimanga is nice and all, but he is a horrible teacher. thank god for the huge curves on every test or no one in my class would have passed. on our first test the average grade was 51 and he was satisfied with that...well i sure wasn't! he has a hard time answering questions since he hasn't mastered the english language yet.
He is the most disorganized professor I've had so far. I do not recommend him unless you are very interested in the subject.

First of all he is not from Kenya. He's from Zimbabwe. He tests your critical thinking skills. If ask him a question he will find a way to get you to figure out the answer by yourself. If you get an A you are good.
Good teacher, but the language barrier is a factor because he is from Kenya...but he tries very hard.  His tests are hard but he curves.  not an easy A but a pretty good class.

He is a very nice man but is too smart for his own good.  He is willing to help when you have questions, but has trouble explaining things in ways that are easy to understand. When he teaches, he will just go into something new and not tell you what he is trying to show you.  The class is very confusing.
He's willing to help students in the class, but he expects you to have read the material. He will teach to the slower people in the class, so it's not hard.

This was a very difficult class for me, but I read the chapters before class and really tried hard. Whatever I could not get from the reading, he cleared up for me in class. If you want to learn and don't mind the work, take him. If you want an easy ride, take another prof.
can be hard to understand for some people because of the accent (he is from kenya.) he was really really helpful and worked with the class if we debated a test question or something.
makes no sence, tells you he will drop the lowest grade, forgets.  kept the class 20 min late EAVERY day, no matter what.  nice guy,just a bad teacher.
Wonderful class once you get past the accent.  Nice guy, lots of xtra credit.
